required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Reyataz in HIV-infected Patients With Lipodystrophy Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV, Open-Label, Randomized, Multicenter Trial Assessing a Reyataz-Based Substitution Approach in the Management of Lipodystrophy Syndrome. Research Into Atazanavir in Lipodystrophy (The REAL Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-infected subjects with abdominal fat accumulation on their highly active antiretroviral treatment (HAART) regimen have better changes in fat distribution after switching to atazanavir-ritonavir than those remaining on their current protease inhibitor boosted HAART regimen.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trunk-to-limb Fat Ratio as Measured by Dual Energy X-Ray Absortiometry (DEXA) at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: Mean changes from Baseline in trunk-to-limb fat ratio as measured by DEXA, an x-ray scan used to measure bone mineral density. Clinical improvement is associated with a decrease in values. (Baseline trunk-to-limb fat ratio values can be found in the Baseline Characteristics section.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trunk-to-limb Fat Ratio as Measured by DEXA at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Mean changes from baseline in trunk-to-limb fat ratio as measured by DEXA, an x-ray scan used to measure bone mineral density. Clinical improvement is associated with a decrease in values.(Baseline trunk-to-limb fat ratio values can be found in the Baseline Characteristics section.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Visceral Adipose Tissue (VAT) Area by Computed Tomography (CT) Scans and in Trunk Fat by DEXA.
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in physical signs of lipohypertrophy, as assessed objectively by changes in visceral adipose tissue (VAT) area (cm2) by computed tomography (CT) scans and by changes in trunk fat (kg) by DEXA. Clinical improvement is associated with a decrease in values. (Baseline values can be found in the Baseline Characteristics section.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Peripheral Adipose Tissue (Limb Fat) by DEXA and by Changes in Subcutaneous Adipose Tissue (SAT) Area by CT Scans
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in physical signs of lipoatrophy, as assessed objectively by changes in peripheral adipose tissue (ie, limb fat (kg) by DEXA and in subcutaneous adipose tissue (SAT) area by CT scans. Clinical improvement is associated with stable values, or an increase in values. (Baseline values can be found in the Baseline Characteristics section.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Total Body Fat by DEXA and in Total Adipose Tissue (TAT) Area by CT Scans
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in total body fat by DEXA and in total adipose tissue (TAT) area by CT scans. Total body fat and TAT are both associated many factors (trunk fat + limb fat + other [weight, etc]), and thus clinical improvement cannot be predicted based solely an increase or decrease of these values. (Baseline values can be found in the Baseline Characteristics section.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Changes From Baseline in Fasting Lipids
secondary_outcome.description: Mean percent changes from baseline in fasting total, low-density lipoprotein (LDL), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), and non-HDL cholesterol, triglycerides, and apolipoprotein B

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Changes From Baseline in Fasting Glucose at Week 48 and Week 96
Mean Changes From Baseline in Fasting Insulin at Week 48 and Week 96
Mean Changes From Baseline in Fasting Homeostasis Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA-IR is an index used in evaluation of obese patients at risk for type 2 diabetes which requires fasting glucose and insulin concentrations. It is a mathematical model based on the theory of a negative feedback loop between the liver and β-cells that regulates both fasting glucose and insulin concentrations and can be used to estimate pancreatic β-cell function and degree of insulin resistance. HOMA-IR normal values are between 2 and 2.5. HOMA-IR ≥ 2.5 indicates insulin-resistance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Changes From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 48 and Week 96
Mean Changes From Baseline in Waist Circumference at Week 48 and Week 96
Mean Changes From Baseline in Body Mass Index at Week 48 and Week 96
Mean Changes From Baseline in Waist-to-Hip Ratio at Week 48 and Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Mean changes from baseline in proportion of waist to hip measurements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Deaths, and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with AEs, Serious AEs (SAEs), Deaths, and AEs leading to discontinuation. An AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Abnormal Liver Function Tests
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with Abnormal Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST), and Total Bilirubin (TBILI) measurements. Values for liver tests are graded using the modified World Health Organization (WHO) criteria. Grade 1 is mild, grade 2 is moderate, grade 3 is severe, grade 4 is life threatening or disabling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Leading to Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with AEs leading to discontinuation of study therapy. An AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. All events listed in this table were SAEs, except for renal impairment and hypertriglycerideamia, which were an AEs (and did not meet the 5 percent threshold reported in Adverse Event module of this record).

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Cumulative Proportion of Participants Without Virologic Rebound (HIV RNA ≥400 c/mL) at Timepoints up to Week 96 in Treated Participants With HIV RNA <400 c/mL at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 8-12, Weeks 20-24, Weeks 32-36, Weeks 44-48, Weeks 56-60, Weeks 68-72, Weeks 80-84, Weeks 92-96
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic rebound was measured from the first dose of study therapy to the first of the 2 consecutive measurements ≥400 c/mL. Time to virologic rebound was analyzed using life tables. Measured Values show the Kaplan-Meier cumulative proportion of participants without virologic rebound up to the end of the respective interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in CD4 Count
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in CD4 count among treated subjects

intervention.intervention_name: Atazanavir (ATV) + ritonavir (RTV), continuation of backbone 2 nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NRTIs)
intervention.description: Capsules, Oral, ATV 300 mg + RTV 100 mg once daily up to 96 weeks

intervention.intervention_name: continuation of current HAART (boosted protease inhibitor [PI] combination + 2 NRTIs)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV-1 infected on HAART regimen containing 2 NRTI and boosted PI for at least 12 weeks prior to screening. Subjects may not have experienced virological failure to more than one prior PI-containing regimen. Must be able to swallow tablets
- Viral load <400 c/mL at screening and stable for at least 6 months
- Signs of fat redistribution and lipohypertrophy (abdominal) Waist to Hip Ratio >0.90 and Waist Circumference >88.2 cm for men and Waist Circumference >75.3 for women
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- New HIV-related opportunistic infections
- Active alcohol or substance use
- Grade 4 lab toxicity
- History of taking atazanavir (ATV)
- Prohibited therapies, including non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NNRTI)

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 219 participants were enrolled and 18 were never randomized (1 poor/noncompliance; 10 no longer met study criteria; 5 withdrew consent). 201 participants were randomized; however, 1 participant was never treated and is not included in the participant flow.

group.title: ATV/RTV Switch Arm
group.description: Participants switching their current treatment with a ritonavir (RTV)-boosted protease inhibitor (PI)-containing highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) regimen to atazanavir (ATV)/RTV (ATV: 2 x 150 mg capsules once daily (QD) / RTV: 1 x 100 mg capsule QD) while continuing their background nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs).

group.title: PI/RTV Control Arm
group.description: Participants continued on their current treatment with an RTV-boosted, PI-containing HAART regimen while continuing their background NRTIs.

participants_list.participants: Number randomized and treated(1 randomized and never treated subject not included in this number.)

milestone.title: Discontinued on or After Week 96 Visit

group.title: ATV/RTV Switch Arm
group.description: Participants switching their current treatment with a ritonavir (RTV)-boosted protease inhibitor (PI)-containing highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) regimen to atazanavir (ATV)/RTV (ATV: 2 x 150 mg capsules once daily (QD) / RTV: 1 x 100 mg capsule QD) while continuing their background nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs).

group.title: PI/RTV Control Arm
group.description: Participants continued on their current treatment with an RTV-boosted, PI-containing HAART regimen while continuing their background NRTIs.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) Distribution
measure.description: CD4=a protein marker on the surface of certain types of T lymphocytes and other cells; HIV binds to CD4 receptors to enter host cells.

measure.title: Fasting Glucose
measure.description: 7 participants in ATV/RTV arm and 3 participants in PI/RTV arm were missing this baseline measurement.

measure.title: Fasting Lipids
measure.description: Triglycerides, non-high density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, total cholesterol, and HDL cholesterol. Values for all baseline fasting lipid measurements were missing for 8 participants in the ATV/RTV arm. Values for baseline fasting LDL cholesterol were missing for 8 participants in the PI/RTV arm; values for all other baseline lipid measurements were missing for 7 participants.

measure.title: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HIV RNA) Distribution
Adipose Tissue at Baseline
measure.description: Visceral, subcutaneous, and total adipose tissue (VAT, SAT, and TAT) as assessed by computed tomography (CT). Values for all 3 measurements were missing for 20 participants in the ATV/RTV arm (n=111). Values for all 3 measurements were missing for 10 participants in the PI/RTV arm (n=59).

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: 131 participants in ATV/RTV arm and 67 participants in PI/RTV arm had this baseline measurement.

measure.title: Body Weight
CD4 Cell Count
measure.description: CD4 cell=a type of white blood cell that bears the CD4 surface receptor and helps coordinate a range of immune system activities.

measure.title: Trunk Fat, Limb Fat, Total Body Fat
measure.description: Values for all 3 baseline fat measurements were missing for 14 participants in the ATV/RTV arm (n=117). Values for baseline trunk fat measurements were missing for 10 participants in the PI/RTV arm (n=59); values for baseline limb fat and total body fat measurements were missing for 13 participants in the PI/RTV arm (n=56).

measure.title: Trunk-to-Limb Fat Ratio
measure.description: 117 participants in ATV/RTV arm and 56 participants in PI/RTV arm had this measure at baseline.

measure.title: Waist Circumference
Waist-to-Hip Ratio
measure.description: 131 participants in ATV/RTV arm and 68 participants in PI/RTV arm had this baseline measurement.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Trunk-to-limb Fat Ratio as Measured by Dual Energy X-Ray Absortiometry (DEXA) at Week 48
outcome.description: Mean changes from Baseline in trunk-to-limb fat ratio as measured by DEXA, an x-ray scan used to measure bone mineral density. Clinical improvement is associated with a decrease in values. (Baseline trunk-to-limb fat ratio values can be found in the Baseline Characteristics section.)
outcome.population: Treated participants. Observed case (OC) analysis: n=participants with fat measurement at baseline and at the analysis timepoint. Last observation carried forward (LOCF): n=participants with fat measurement at baseline and at or before the analysis timepoint.

HOMA-IR normal values are between 2 and 2.5. HOMA-IR ≥ 2.5 indicates insulin-resistance.

group.description: Participants switching their current treatment with a ritonavir (RTV)-boosted protease inhibitor (PI)-containing highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) regimen to atazanavir (ATV)/RTV (ATV: 2 x 150 mg capsules once daily (QD) / RTV: 1 x 100 mg capsule QD) while continuing their background nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs).

group.description: Participants continued on their current treatment with an RTV-boosted, PI-containing HAART regimen while continuing their background NRTIs.

measure.title: Mean Changes From Baseline in Waist-to-Hip Ratio at Week 48 and Week 96
measure.description: Mean changes from baseline in proportion of waist to hip measurements.
measure.population: LOCF; n=number of participants with baseline value and value at or before analysis timepoint

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Deaths, and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with AEs, Serious AEs (SAEs), Deaths, and AEs leading to discontinuation. An AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

group.title: ATV/RTV Switch Arm
group.description: Participants switching their current treatment with a ritonavir (RTV)-boosted protease inhibitor (PI)-containing highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) regimen to atazanavir (ATV)/RTV (ATV: 2 x 150 mg capsules once daily (QD) / RTV: 1 x 100 mg capsule QD) while continuing their background nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs).

group.title: PI/RTV Control Arm
group.description: Participants continued on their current treatment with an RTV-boosted, PI-containing HAART regimen while continuing their background NRTIs.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Deaths, and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
measure.description: Percentage of Participants with AEs, Serious AEs (SAEs), Deaths, and AEs leading to discontinuation. An AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a cancer, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Abnormal Liver Function Tests
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with Abnormal Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST), and Total Bilirubin (TBILI) measurements. Values for liver tests are graded using the modified World Health Organization (WHO) criteria. Grade 1 is mild, grade 2 is moderate, grade 3 is severe, grade 4 is life threatening or disabling.

group.title: ATV/RTV Switch Arm
group.description: Participants switching their current treatment with a ritonavir (RTV)-boosted protease inhibitor (PI)-containing highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) regimen to atazanavir (ATV)/RTV (ATV: 2 x 150 mg capsules once daily (QD) / RTV: 1 x 100 mg capsule QD) while continuing their background nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs).

group.title: PI/RTV Control Arm
group.description: Participants continued on their current treatment with an RTV-boosted, PI-containing HAART regimen while continuing their background NRTIs.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Abnormal Liver Function Tests
measure.description: Percentage of participants with Abnormal Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST), and Total Bilirubin (TBILI) measurements. Values for liver tests are graded using the modified World Health Organization (WHO) criteria. Grade 1 is mild, grade 2 is moderate, grade 3 is severe, grade 4 is life threatening or disabling.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Leading to Discontinuation
outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with AEs leading to discontinuation of study therapy. An AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. All events listed in this table were SAEs, except for renal impairment and hypertriglycerideamia, which were an AEs (and did not meet the 5 percent threshold reported in Adverse Event module of this record).

group.title: ATV/RTV Switch Arm
group.description: Participants switching their current treatment with a ritonavir (RTV)-boosted protease inhibitor (PI)-containing highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) regimen to atazanavir (ATV)/RTV (ATV: 2 x 150 mg capsules once daily (QD) / RTV: 1 x 100 mg capsule QD) while continuing their background nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs).

group.description: Participants continued on their current treatment with an RTV-boosted, PI-containing HAART regimen while continuing their background NRTIs.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) Leading to Discontinuation
measure.description: Percentage of Participants with AEs leading to discontinuation of study therapy. An AE is defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition. All events listed in this table were SAEs, except for renal impairment and hypertriglycerideamia, which were an AEs (and did not meet the 5 percent threshold reported in Adverse Event module of this record).

class.title: Any adverse experience leading to discontinuation

outcome.title: Kaplan-Meier Cumulative Proportion of Participants Without Virologic Rebound (HIV RNA ≥400 c/mL) at Timepoints up to Week 96 in Treated Participants With HIV RNA <400 c/mL at Baseline
outcome.description: Virologic rebound was measured from the first dose of study therapy to the first of the 2 consecutive measurements ≥400 c/mL. Time to virologic rebound was analyzed using life tables. Measured Values show the Kaplan-Meier cumulative proportion of participants without virologic rebound up to the end of the respective interval.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 8-12, Weeks 20-24, Weeks 32-36, Weeks 44-48, Weeks 56-60, Weeks 68-72, Weeks 80-84, Weeks 92-96
outcome.population: Treated subjects with HIV RNA <400 c/mL at baseline.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
